snippet: Lawyers for the clerk, who was jailed last week because of her refusal to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, said that they had filed an emergency motion hoping to free her.
abstract: Attorneys for imprisoned Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis file motion for her release with United States appeals court; motion requests that governor allow clerk, who refuses to sign same-sex marriage certificates on religious grounds, to remove her name and title from them.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the clerk, who was jailed last week because of her refusal to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, said that they had filed an emergency motion hoping to free her.

headline.main: Kentucky: Release of County Clerk Is Sought
headline.print_headline: Kentucky: Release of County Clerk Is Sought

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
